intro: Acinopetala wendlandiana, commonly known as the Wendland's acinopetala, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its daisy-like flowers with yellow centers and white petals. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is well adapted to arid conditions. It produces small, linear leaves and has a compact, shrub-like growth form. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely distributed outside its native range.
